document_data.mainbody:
The flying helm of Ravilars Cloak was a legendary mysterious item or a supernatural phenomenon that was rumored to be manifested by souls of dead warriors of Turmish.
The flying helm of Ravilars Cloak was indeed a magical flying helmet. Some believed that it was created by infusing the item with the souls of the dead. It was said that once this ordinary-looking helmet was put on ones head, it became connected to its owner, and its true nature was only revealed after the owners death.
By the late-14 century, legends of the flying helm became one of the most well-known facts about the village of Ravilars Cloak in Turmish. Some witnessed the floating helmet moving across the towns streets, collecting stray lost coins. Locals claimed that the helmet could pick up small items and carry them away to places unknown. When something became lost or misplaced, townies of the Cloak blamed the infamous flying helm.
At some point before the , Adamar Session, Bard of Starmantle, recorded tales of the flying helm during his twelve-year adventuring trek across the Reach.
